description.2914:
Skill Requirements
	Workday FINS experience in a complex organization and ability to manage workload and prioritize effectively to meet customer expectations
	Ability to accurately collect information to understand and assess the clients’ needs
	Excellent finance/accounting knowledge in a global business and ability to communicate with finance colleagues
	Understanding of Shared Services operating models
	Strong ability to inspire and engage with a diverse team and create an inclusive culture across geographical boundaries
	Develop trusted relationships with key stakeholders in WPP IT and across the wider WPP business
	Strong technical knowledge of integrations is a plus
	Creative solutioning and strong problem-solving skills
	Excellent interpersonal and communication skills both with technical and non-technical audiences

description.2986:
Relationship Management:
o	Managing the banking and investments relationship of YES FIRST clients and responsible for overall growth of Liabilities & Investment business from HNI segment
o	Develop, manage, and expand YES FIRST customer relationships by providing service level which exceeds client expectations of most important customer segment.
o	Identify current and potential relationship with additional revenue potential and grow business
	Generating Incremental Business
o	Sales targets spread across liabilities, retail assets, business banking, forex, cards, investments etc.
o	Proactively sell the full range of consumer and commercial product to current and potential Yes FIRST HNI Relationships
o	Increase CASA balance in allocated portfolio either through Deepening or Acquisition
o	Driving higher product and channel penetration to deepen mapped relationships and to increase wallet share with YES Bank
	Customer Engagement:
o	Ensuring portfolio quality by regularly engaging with each mapped relationship and maintaining the desired relationship values
o	Face to the client and First Person Responsible for service and sales satisfaction of mapped clients
	Investment Advisory
o	Financial Planning and Investment Advisory to HNI clients
o	Driving revenue business to generate fee income through products like mutual funds, investments and insurance
	Process and Audit
o	Ensure all sales activity is recorded online as per the organizational process
o	Capture and maximize the business opportunity through detailed client profiling as per organizational process
description.2987:
Relationship Management:
o	Managing the banking and investments relationship of YES FIRST clients and responsible for overall growth of Liabilities & Investment business from HNI segment
o	Develop, manage, and expand YES FIRST customer relationships by providing service level which exceeds client expectations of most important customer segment.
o	Identify current and potential relationship with additional revenue potential and grow business
	Generating Incremental Business
o	Sales targets spread across liabilities, retail assets, business banking, forex, cards, investments etc.
o	Proactively sell the full range of consumer and commercial product to current and potential Yes FIRST HNI Relationships
o	Increase CASA balance in allocated portfolio either through Deepening or Acquisition
o	Driving higher product and channel penetration to deepen mapped relationships and to increase wallet share with YES Bank
	Customer Engagement:
o	Ensuring portfolio quality by regularly engaging with each mapped relationship and maintaining the desired relationship values
o	Face to the client and First Person Responsible for service and sales satisfaction of mapped clients
	Investment Advisory
o	Financial Planning and Investment Advisory to HNI clients
o	Driving revenue business to generate fee income through products like mutual funds, investments and insurance
	Process and Audit
o	Ensure all sales activity is recorded online as per the organizational process
o	Capture and maximize the business opportunity through detailed client profiling as per organizational process

description.3850:
Ensures Accounts Payable were paid in an accurate and timely manner while adhering to departmental policies and procedure. 
	Processing & Registering the matching Media invoices utilizing the designated Finance accounting system. 
	Handle payment related queries from Vendors
	Identify, highlight and resolve issues related to process, statutory compliance etc.
	Timely payout to vendors as per defined SLA/TAT
	Follow-up on the SOA with vendor
	Able to handle GL queries
	Vendor reconciliation
	Generating and distributing monthly financial reports.
	Performing bank reconciliation for the Accounts payable account and updated the general ledger system as needed for outstanding checks. 
	Know how to handle and manage the conference calls with international stakeholders

description.4013:
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

	Lead Recruitment for FPI, WPP Entities.
	Coordinate with department managers to forecast future hiring needs.
	Optimize Social Media channels of recruitment namely LinkedIN, Naukri, Employee Referrals etc.
	Optimize Vendor Hiring for Critical & Urgent Vacancies.
	Implement new sourcing methods (e.g. social recruiting and Boolean searches).
	Prepare and present recruitment Reports and Dashboards on weekly basis 
	Ensure timely updates are released to Internal HR Teams, Country Head, Stakeholders, Finance, IT, Admin team as appropriate in guidance from Head HR.
	Pre-Hiring Engagement with Selected Candidates.
	Ensure MRF is thoroughly checked & completed by the stakeholder before accepting the same for Recruitment.
	Ensuring to have the job descriptions for the role before accepting the MRF from the stakeholder.
	Coordinate with prospective candidates for pre-joining and on-boarding formalities;
	Ensuring HRBP, IT, Admin, Payroll is updated on DOJ of all forecasted joiners through a weekly Friday report.
	Supervise BGV (Documentation, Initiation, Report follow-up, Discrepancy follow ups)
	Keep track of recruiting metrics (e.g. time-to-hire and cost-per-hire)
	Lead Recruitment Automation
	Update current and design new recruiting procedures and methods.
	Advise hiring managers on interviewing techniques
	Anticipating the organizations future hiring plans and work with senior executives to advise on recruiting tactics and building Talent Pipeline.
	Stakeholder Management.








ROLE-SPECIFIC SKILLS/ATTRIBUTE

Skills/Experience
	Minimum 12+ years of experiencing in Talent Acquisition.
	Qualified MBA or equivalent.
	Proven experience working as a Recruiting Manager.
	Hands-on experience with Applicant Tracking Systems
	Strong Communication and Negotiation skills
	Self-motivated 
	Commercially focused with a strong stakeholder management approach.
	Strong experience in People Management
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Excellent management and leadership skills.
	Calm under pressure.

	Anticipating the organizations future hiring plans and work with senior executives to advise on recruiting tactics and building Talent Pipeline.
	Stakeholder Management.








ROLE-SPECIFIC SKILLS/ATTRIBUTE

Skills/Experience
	Minimum 12+ years of experiencing in Talent Acquisition.
	Qualified MBA or equivalent.
	Proven experience working as a Recruiting Manager.
	Hands-on experience with Applicant Tracking Systems
	Strong Communication and Negotiation skills
	Self-motivated 
	Commercially focused with a strong stakeholder management approach.
	Strong experience in People Management
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Excellent management and leadership skills.
	Calm under pressure.
description.4203:
Key Deliverables:
	You will be expected to achieve the sales targets and qualitative & quantitative objectives set by the Regional Sales Manager
	You will drive business growth and manage distributors in the assigned territory
	You will be responsible to motivate, manage and develop customers (Salons) within a given geographic area for a specific brand portfolio
	You will have to identify opportunities and win new customers in accordance with the objectives set by the brand
	You need to ensure an effective educational partnership (recruit customers for training, attending events, etc.) in coordination with the Technical/Training team
	You will be responsible to ensure the range availability of the brand
	You will be accountable for the Social Commerce agenda of the region
	You will be expected to manage Distributor Sales Representatives (DSRs)
description.4730:
Ensures Accounts Payable were paid in an accurate and timely manner while adhering to departmental policies and procedure. 
	Processing & Registering the matching Media invoices utilizing the designated Finance accounting system. 
	Handle payment related queries from Vendors
	Identify, highlight and resolve issues related to process, statutory compliance etc.
	Timely payout to vendors as per defined SLA/TAT
	Follow-up on the SOA with vendor
	Able to handle GL queries
	Vendor reconciliation
	Generating and distributing monthly financial reports.
	Performing bank reconciliation for the Accounts payable account and updated the general ledger system as needed for outstanding checks. 
	Know how to handle and manage the conference calls with international stakeholders

description.4943:
Role: Assistant Manager – Field sales
Experience: 2 to 6 years
Qualification: BE/ B. Tech/ MBA
Target industry: TMT, Cement, Tiles, Glass, Construction equipment’s.

•	Looking for candidate with experience in B2B sales.
•	Current or prior experience in B2B sales is mandatory.  Pure channels sales experience will not work.
•	Candidate must be doing cold calling on regular basis.
•	Must be visiting 7-8 clients/day basis.
•	Will be responsible for hunting site.
•	Will be dealing with builder, architects, project manager, site heads, etc.
•	Will be responsible for managing TMT and Cement product.
•	Territory experience is mandatory.
•	Candidate must be working on-roll with the employers.
description.5016:
To ensure that Junior / Senior AML officers in the team carry out timely review of alerts
•     To ensure timely review of ‘Ground of Suspicion’ (GOS), approve STR and review all other work done by the team.
•     To ensure timely reporting to FIU-IND and liaise with FIU-IND in case of any delays.
•     To analyze alerts scenarios implemented in the AML system and identify areas for reduction of false positive alerts based on review.
•     To implement changes in the parameter and thresholds to reduce false positives post review and approval.
•     To ensure availability of complete audit trail and evidences which were referred to for closure of an alert or filing of STR.
To ensure adherence to TATs as defined in the function.

Team Mentoring:
•     Provide guidance, direction and all necessary support to individual team member and to team as a whole to help them discharge their duties effectively, improve performance, reduce conflict, increase team collaboration and keep team focused on individual / team / organizational goals
•     Mentor and coach subordinates to develop the team’s capabilities and build a robust back up for all activities, including team monitoring in absence of team leader
description.5031: Working as a member of the Global Electrical & Control Discipline team carrying out design appraisal and consultancy against a range of Class Rules and statutory codes. You will be principally working with marine electrical/automation/electronic aspects for existing or new construction merchant ships but there will be opportunities to be involved with other ship types and offshore projects in line with business needs. · Conducting approval of electrical and control equipment and components against various statutory codes and Class Rules. Carrying out Type Approval activity for electrical and control equipment. · To build and maintain a good relationship with our clients and internal stakeholders.
description.5120:
Roles & Responsibilities:
 Formulation of strategic sales plans, tactics, budget including monthly, annual and long term
plans and setting up Retail footprint in assigned territories
 Plan, coordinate and direct field implementation of company & sales efforts by managing
activities of the sales executives to achieve the sales and collection goals of the company
 Identify customer issues and resolve sales related difficulties
 Manage the performance of the sales team to meet individual, function and company sales
goals and objectives including feedback on performance appraisals, recommendations for merit
increases, career counselling, etc.
 Works with other functions to drive promotional campaigns, incentives, and rebate programs
 Manage and review regular sales reports, forecasts and communication with sales and
marketing management
Preferred Qualifications:
 Need candidates from good pedigree and excellent analytical skills.
 8+ years of overall work experience in Sales, Distribution Management, Capability Building,
 Sales Strategies Formulations & large team handling.
 Preferred industry: Building material (Cement preferred), FMCG

description.5133:
•	Carry out the 1st level assessment of Cloud security Controls, primarily for Bank hosted or Cloud hosted setups and carry out assessment/ tests of cloud infrastructure at CSPs/private cloud at Bank and test controls specific to cloud native application and architecture as part of pre-implementation audits of new projects/ applications to be implemented in the Bank and subsequent periodic audits as per the methodology followed in the bank.
•	Assess compliance of the Cloud IT operations and security with Bank's policies and regulatory guidelines, international standards and best practices.
•	Assist TLs / ZHs in the performance of audit assignments as per the needs of the senior management and changing risk perceptions from time-to-time.
•	E4-level may have 0 to 2 reportees
description.5366:
Position: Area Sales Manager

No. of Positions: 1

Designation: Deputy Manager / Manager - Sales

Qualifications: Graduate with a minimum of 5-8 years sales / marketing experience in Steel / allied products; Preferably with MBA

Base Location:

Reporting to:

Direct Reporting: Regional Sales Manager

Dotted line Reporting:

Key Roles & Responsibilities:

 Co-ordinate with central / regional sales & marketing team to formulate annual / monthly business plan of contract manufacturing initiative for their respective areas.

 Ensure generation of sales / leads in accordance to annual / monthly sales business plan.

 Responsible for sales order generation in co-ordination with the distributor sales force.

 Responsible for network expansion at distributor / dealer level as per business requirements.

 Co-ordinate with the regional sales manager (at Kolkata) and dispatch & compliance officer / supply chain officer who are stationed at the contract manufacturer premise for timely production and delivery of the material to distributor / dealer locations.

 Monitoring competition prices and activities in the market and updating the Regional Sales Manager / central sales & marketing team of the same.

 Ensure order compliance at distributor / dealer level and logging of sales orders in the system.

 Generate leads for project sales in co-ordination with central / regional sales team.

 Monitoring of complaints raised by distributors / dealers and ensure that the complaints are resolved in a timely manner.

 Driving national / regional / local marketing initiatives as directed.

 Drive brand exclusivity initiatives at distributor level (to the best extent possible).

 Maintain contacts and periodic visits to distributors / dealers as per the business requirement.

 Ensure that the distributors meet all the legal / statutory requirements.

 Capability building of distributor sales force including technical and sales skills.

 Resolving channel conflict as and when required

description.7012:
We are currently looking for District Representative to join our amazing organization at Jharsuguda, Odisha location, and I think you would be a great fit. We request you to please go through the job description mentioned below and do let us know if this is something that excites you.

 

Role

District Representative

Qualification

Graduate

Experience

8 to 15 Years

Location

Jharsuguda, Odisha

 

Job Description

  • Achieves annual sales targets by working with the District Manager and senior district sales personnel to establish selling strategy and tactics.
  • Obtains orders and establishes new accounts; plans and organizes daily work; calls on existing and potential sales customers. Analyses customer needs, requirements, and strategic plans recommending solutions with Company programs.
  • Keeps management informed through regular activity reports and communications.
  • Calls on customer facilities and observes and implements practical application of products. 
  • Services assigned accounts. 
  • Recommends changes in chemical dosages, flow rates, or equipment. 
  • Reports changes or problems to Account Manager and then customer.
  • Begins to work with existing customers to seek new applications for existing products. 
  • With assistance from senior sales personnel and the Account Manager, develops and executes account sales plans. Upon attaining the required level of technical competency and sales skills, assumes both sales and service responsibilities within an assigned territory. 
  • Applies the Six Service Standards striving to improve their quality and document value provided to the customer.
  • Under direct supervision, plans and carries out sales and service calls. Maintains close contact with district management regarding account activity, customer needs, prices, competitor activity, and  Nalco product acceptability.
  • Develops and maintains a sales pyramid and other required reports or documentation.
  • Demonstrates safe driving techniques and maintains company car and equipment in a neat and professional manner.
  • Supports and is committed to Nalco's Quality Improvement Process and the guiding principles of Responsible Care®, and its six Codes of Management Practice
  • District incidents and identified safety improvements
  • Team compliance with safety policies and training completion
  • District sales vs target and vs last year; gross margin vs target and vs last year
  • Quality of analysis and documented prioritized action plan
  • New program sales and penetration
  • Price increases realized and district service level commitments met
  • Contract compliance
  • Customer and district profitability
  • Quality of district business review documentation; customer feedback
  • Customer retention

description.7215:
Job Description

 

Job Title

Executive – Quality

Function

Manufacturing

Location

 

Reporting Structure

Reports to

Unit Quality Manager

Direct Reports

Nil

 

 

 

JOB PURPOSE

 

  • To ensure adherence to laid down Quality standards and systems by effective monitoring process, system & products at lines.
  • Implementation of Quality & Food Safety requirements at lines as per SOPs & standards.
  • To ensure compliance to FSSAI & legal requirements at lines.
  • Establish root cause & CAPA for deviations/ nonconformance in coordination with production team.
  • New Product/Restaging/Online trails as per standards & SOP
  • To Impart training & counseling to pre inspectors, Label inspectors, EOL inspectors & critical inspections.

 

 

 

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Complete Top of line checks as per frequency in bottling & rinsing section.
  • Monitoring of critical process parameters like strength, volume, CCP, OPRP etc.
  • Daily Update production plan at OLI tablets & analysis of data to establish RCA to avoid reoccurrences.
  • Ensure sequences are done as per frequencies by dedicated resources of their respective lines
  • Initiate RCA & CAPA in cases of deviation observed at lines to mitigate the risk.
  • Handling of rework at station as per SOP
  • Verify changeover process at respective lines to ensure compliances
  • RFT tracking for respective lines & analysis of data to establish improvement plan.
  • Support daily FGWA for initiating corrections & corrective actions.
  • Ensure routine CIPs, cleanings & hygiene regimes at respective lines.
  • Ensure & monitor rinsing parameters of respective lines for effectiveness of the process.
  • Ensure allocation of right manpower on each line & manpower rotation.
  • Impart training & counseling workmen related to personnel hygiene, GMP requirements, critical checks etc.
  • Ensure right changeover as per process on the respective lines
  • Verification of records pertaining to process & quality checks for correctness.
  • Ensure compliance to legal mandatories as per excise requirements & FSSAI requirements on products.
  • To conduct PDI as per requirements for finished products.
  • Conduct weekly challenge test at critical inspection location
  • To investigate & establishing CAPA for consumer complaints & incidents.
  • To generate monthly MIS on trends related to OLI, exceptions etc. with mitigation plan
  • Ensure implementation of Pre-Requisite programs at respective lines
  • Participation in internal audit program related to quality & food safety.
  • Participation in validation of quality & food safety control measures
  • Ensure New product launch/restaging/ online trails as per protocols
  • Participation in HACCP study of respective lines to address food safety risk
  • Mange changes at lines through change management
  • Implement best practices & 5S to improve product quality & hygiene
  • Implementation of safety culture at lines through trainings & awareness

 

KPIs

  • Right First Time- RFT
  • Acceptable Quality Level-AQL
  • Monthly Unit FGWA Conformity Rate-UCR
  • Consumer Complaints
  • Internal & External audits
  • Site & Hygiene assessment score
  • New Product initiatives, Change management
  • Market Assessment score
  • Safety Performance i.e. LTA, First aids, Near Miss etc.

 

 

JOB REQUIREMENTS

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • B.Tech -Food Technology/Dairy Technology/Alcohol Technology

 

 

EXPERIENCE:

  • 3 to 4 years of relevant experience in online quality monitoring in a food & beverage industry of good repute.
  • Good knowledge on ISO9001 & FSSC22000 standards.
  • knowledge on FSSAI and other relevant regulations of the industry
  • Knowledge & hands on experience on problem solving technics i.e. 7 QC tools etc.
  • Experience on use of statistical tools and their applications

 

BEHAVIORAL COMPETENCIES

Bold & Agile-

  • Decisive and courageous even in the face of difficult & complex situations and always learns from past experiences. Stepping up to address difficult issues, saying what needs to be said in a respectful way.
  • Courage
  • Decision quality
  • Nimble learning

Consumer Centric

  • Develops customer/consumer intimacy with a focus on technology to innovate and create more value for the consumer and Pernod Ricard
  • Consumer focus
  • Cultivates innovation
  • Tech Savvy

Deliver through collaboration

  • Achieves results while balancing rigorous planning and flexible transversal collaboration. Building partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives.
  • Drive results
  • Collaborates
  • Plans & aligns

 

 

PR India JD / 2021                                                                                             Page 1 of 3

description.7217:
Job Description

 

Job Title

Executive – Quality

Function

Manufacturing

Location

 

Reporting Structure

Reports to

Unit Quality Manager

Direct Reports

Nil

 

 

 

JOB PURPOSE

 

  • To ensure adherence to laid down Quality standards and systems by effective monitoring process, system & products at lines.
  • Implementation of Quality & Food Safety requirements at lines as per SOPs & standards.
  • To ensure compliance to FSSAI & legal requirements at lines.
  • Establish root cause & CAPA for deviations/ nonconformance in coordination with production team.
  • New Product/Restaging/Online trails as per standards & SOP
  • To Impart training & counseling to pre inspectors, Label inspectors, EOL inspectors & critical inspections.

 

 

 

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Complete Top of line checks as per frequency in bottling & rinsing section.
  • Monitoring of critical process parameters like strength, volume, CCP, OPRP etc.
  • Daily Update production plan at OLI tablets & analysis of data to establish RCA to avoid reoccurrences.
  • Ensure sequences are done as per frequencies by dedicated resources of their respective lines
  • Initiate RCA & CAPA in cases of deviation observed at lines to mitigate the risk.
  • Handling of rework at station as per SOP
  • Verify changeover process at respective lines to ensure compliances
  • RFT tracking for respective lines & analysis of data to establish improvement plan.
  • Support daily FGWA for initiating corrections & corrective actions.
  • Ensure routine CIPs, cleanings & hygiene regimes at respective lines.
  • Ensure & monitor rinsing parameters of respective lines for effectiveness of the process.
  • Ensure allocation of right manpower on each line & manpower rotation.
  • Impart training & counseling workmen related to personnel hygiene, GMP requirements, critical checks etc.
  • Ensure right changeover as per process on the respective lines
  • Verification of records pertaining to process & quality checks for correctness.
  • Ensure compliance to legal mandatories as per excise requirements & FSSAI requirements on products.
  • To conduct PDI as per requirements for finished products.
  • Conduct weekly challenge test at critical inspection location
  • To investigate & establishing CAPA for consumer complaints & incidents.
  • To generate monthly MIS on trends related to OLI, exceptions etc. with mitigation plan
  • Ensure implementation of Pre-Requisite programs at respective lines
  • Participation in internal audit program related to quality & food safety.
  • Participation in validation of quality & food safety control measures
  • Ensure New product launch/restaging/ online trails as per protocols
  • Participation in HACCP study of respective lines to address food safety risk
  • Mange changes at lines through change management
  • Implement best practices & 5S to improve product quality & hygiene
  • Implementation of safety culture at lines through trainings & awareness

 

KPIs

  • Right First Time- RFT
  • Acceptable Quality Level-AQL
  • Monthly Unit FGWA Conformity Rate-UCR
  • Consumer Complaints
  • Internal & External audits
  • Site & Hygiene assessment score
  • New Product initiatives, Change management
  • Market Assessment score
  • Safety Performance i.e. LTA, First aids, Near Miss etc.

 

 

JOB REQUIREMENTS

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • B.Tech -Food Technology/Dairy Technology/Alcohol Technology

 

 

EXPERIENCE:

  • 3 to 4 years of relevant experience in online quality monitoring in a food & beverage industry of good repute.
  • Good knowledge on ISO9001 & FSSC22000 standards.
  • knowledge on FSSAI and other relevant regulations of the industry
  • Knowledge & hands on experience on problem solving technics i.e. 7 QC tools etc.
  • Experience on use of statistical tools and their applications

 

BEHAVIORAL COMPETENCIES

Bold & Agile-

  • Decisive and courageous even in the face of difficult & complex situations and always learns from past experiences. Stepping up to address difficult issues, saying what needs to be said in a respectful way.
  • Courage
  • Decision quality
  • Nimble learning

Consumer Centric

  • Develops customer/consumer intimacy with a focus on technology to innovate and create more value for the consumer and Pernod Ricard
  • Consumer focus
  • Cultivates innovation
  • Tech Savvy

Deliver through collaboration

  • Achieves results while balancing rigorous planning and flexible transversal collaboration. Building partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives.
  • Drive results
  • Collaborates
  • Plans & aligns

description.7337:
JOB DESCRIPTION


Data Engineer (Manager)

Godrej Consumer Products Limited (GCPL)

Mumbai, Maharashtra, India


Job Title: Data Engineer

Job Type: Permanent, Full-time

Function: Information Technology

Business: Godrej Consumer Products Limited

Location: Mumbai, Maharashtra, India


About Godrej Industries Limited and Associate Companies (GILAC)

GILAC is a holding company of the Godrej Group. We have significant interests in consumer goods, real estate, agriculture, chemicals, and financial services through our subsidiary and associate companies, across 18 countries.

https://www.godrejindustries.com/

 

About Godrej Consumer Products Limited (GCPL)

Godrej Consumer Products is a leading emerging markets company. As part of the over 125-year young Godrej Group, we are fortunate to have a proud legacy built on the strong values of trust, integrity and respect for others. At the same time, we are growing fast and have exciting, ambitious aspirations.

https://www.godrejcp.com/

 

About the role

This role holder will act as a Data Engineering Project Lead. The role holder is responsible for implementation and support for data engineering projects (primarily on Microsoft Azure platform) through our partner eco system for our businesses globally. The responsibility also includes evaluation and implementation of new features and products like Gen AI etc. of Azure data platform and driving standardization of Azure technology stack and data engineering and coding best practices for Azure projects.

 

Key Responsibilities

  •     Designing and implementing scalable and secure data processing pipelines using Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, and other Azure services.
  •     Managing and optimizing data storage using Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure SQL Data Warehouse.
  •     Developing data models and maintaining data architecture to support data analytics and business intelligence reporting.
  •     Ensuring data quality and consistency through data cleaning, transformation, and integration processes.
  •     Monitoring and troubleshooting data-related issues within the Azure environment to maintain high availability and performance.
  •     Collaborating with data scientists, business analysts, and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and implement appropriate data solutions.
  •     Implementing data security measures, including encryption, access controls, and auditing, to protect sensitive information.
  •     Automating data pipelines and workflows to streamline data ingestion, processing, and distribution tasks.
  •     Utilizing Azure's analytics services, such as Azure Synapse Analytics, to provide insights and support data-driven decision-making.
  •     Keeping abreast of the latest Azure features and technologies to enhance data engineering processes and capabilities.
  •     Documenting data procedures, systems, and architectures to maintain clarity and ensure compliance with regulatory standards.
  •     Providing guidance and support for data governance, including metadata management, data lineage, and data cataloging.

 

What’s in it for you?

Be an equal parent

Maternity support, including paid leave ahead of statutory guidelines, and flexible work options on return

Paternity support, including paid leave

New mothers can bring a caregiver and children under a year old, on work travel

Adoption support; gender neutral and based on the primary caregiver, with paid leave options

 

No place for discrimination at Godrej

Gender-neutral anti-harassment policy

Same sex partner benefits at par with married spouses

Gender transition support

We are selfish about your wellness

Comprehensive health insurance plans, as well as accident coverage for you and your family, with top-up options

Uncapped sick leave

Mental wellness and self-care programmes, resources and counselling

Celebrating wins, the Godrej Way 

Structured recognition platforms for individual, team and business-level achievements

Performance-based earning opportunities

https://www.godrejcareers.com/benefits/

 

An inclusive Godrej

 

Before you go, there is something important we want to highlight. There is no place for discrimination at Godrej. Diversity is the philosophy of who we are as a company. And has been for over a century. It’s not just in our DNA and nice to do. Being more diverse - especially having our team members reflect the diversity of our businesses and communities - helps us innovate better and grow faster. We hope this resonates with you.

 

We take pride in being an equal opportunities employer. We recognise merit and encourage diversity. We do not tolerate any form of discrimination on the basis of nationality, race, colour, religion, caste, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, age, or marital status and ensure equal opportunities for all our team members.


If this sounds like a role for you, apply now!

We look forward to meeting you.

Data Engineer (Manager)

Mumbai, Maharashtra, India


Job Title: Data Engineer

Job Type: Permanent, Full-time

Function: Information Technology

Business: Godrej Consumer Products Limited

Location: Mumbai, Maharashtra, India


About Godrej Industries Limited and Associate Companies (GILAC)

GILAC is a holding company of the Godrej Group. We have significant interests in consumer goods, real estate, agriculture, chemicals, and financial services through our subsidiary and associate companies, across 18 countries.

https://www.godrejindustries.com/

 

About Godrej Consumer Products Limited (GCPL)

Godrej Consumer Products is a leading emerging markets company. As part of the over 125-year young Godrej Group, we are fortunate to have a proud legacy built on the strong values of trust, integrity and respect for others. At the same time, we are growing fast and have exciting, ambitious aspirations.

https://www.godrejcp.com/

 

About the role

This role holder will act as a Data Engineering Project Lead. The role holder is responsible for implementation and support for data engineering projects (primarily on Microsoft Azure platform) through our partner eco system for our businesses globally. The responsibility also includes evaluation and implementation of new features and products like Gen AI etc. of Azure data platform and driving standardization of Azure technology stack and data engineering and coding best practices for Azure projects.

 

Key Responsibilities

  •     Designing and implementing scalable and secure data processing pipelines using Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, and other Azure services.
  •     Managing and optimizing data storage using Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure SQL Data Warehouse.
  •     Developing data models and maintaining data architecture to support data analytics and business intelligence reporting.
  •     Ensuring data quality and consistency through data cleaning, transformation, and integration processes.
  •     Monitoring and troubleshooting data-related issues within the Azure environment to maintain high availability and performance.
  •     Collaborating with data scientists, business analysts, and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and implement appropriate data solutions.
  •     Implementing data security measures, including encryption, access controls, and auditing, to protect sensitive information.
  •     Automating data pipelines and workflows to streamline data ingestion, processing, and distribution tasks.
  •     Utilizing Azure's analytics services, such as Azure Synapse Analytics, to provide insights and support data-driven decision-making.
  •     Keeping abreast of the latest Azure features and technologies to enhance data engineering processes and capabilities.
  •     Documenting data procedures, systems, and architectures to maintain clarity and ensure compliance with regulatory standards.
  •     Providing guidance and support for data governance, including metadata management, data lineage, and data cataloging.

 

What’s in it for you?

Be an equal parent

Maternity support, including paid leave ahead of statutory guidelines, and flexible work options on return

Paternity support, including paid leave

New mothers can bring a caregiver and children under a year old, on work travel

Adoption support; gender neutral and based on the primary caregiver, with paid leave options

 

No place for discrimination at Godrej

Gender-neutral anti-harassment policy

Same sex partner benefits at par with married spouses

Gender transition support

We are selfish about your wellness

Comprehensive health insurance plans, as well as accident coverage for you and your family, with top-up options

Uncapped sick leave

Mental wellness and self-care programmes, resources and counselling

Celebrating wins, the Godrej Way 

Structured recognition platforms for individual, team and business-level achievements

Performance-based earning opportunities

https://www.godrejcareers.com/benefits/

 

An inclusive Godrej

And has been for over a century. It’s not just in our DNA and nice to do. Before you go, there is something important we want to highlight. There is no place for discrimination at Godrej. Diversity is the philosophy of who we are as a company. And has been for over a century. It’s not just in our DNA and nice to do. Being more diverse - especially having our team members reflect the diversity of our businesses and communities - helps us innovate better and grow faster. We hope this resonates with you.

 

We take pride in being an equal opportunities employer. We recognise merit and encourage diversity. We do not tolerate any form of discrimination on the basis of nationality, race, colour, religion, caste, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, age, or marital status and ensure equal opportunities for all our team members.

description.7346:
JOB DESCRIPTION


Data Engineer (Manager)

Godrej Consumer Products Limited (GCPL)

Mumbai, Maharashtra, India


Job Title: Data Engineer

Job Type: Permanent, Full-time

Function: Information Technology

Business: Godrej Consumer Products Limited

Location: Mumbai, Maharashtra, India


About Godrej Industries Limited and Associate Companies (GILAC)

GILAC is a holding company of the Godrej Group. We have significant interests in consumer goods, real estate, agriculture, chemicals, and financial services through our subsidiary and associate companies, across 18 countries.

https://www.godrejindustries.com/

 

About Godrej Consumer Products Limited (GCPL)

Godrej Consumer Products is a leading emerging markets company. As part of the over 125-year young Godrej Group, we are fortunate to have a proud legacy built on the strong values of trust, integrity and respect for others. At the same time, we are growing fast and have exciting, ambitious aspirations.

https://www.godrejcp.com/

 

About the role

This role holder will act as a Data Engineering Project Lead. The role holder is responsible for implementation and support for data engineering projects (primarily on Microsoft Azure platform) through our partner eco system for our businesses globally. The responsibility also includes evaluation and implementation of new features and products like Gen AI etc. of Azure data platform and driving standardization of Azure technology stack and data engineering and coding best practices for Azure projects.

 

Key Responsibilities

  •     Designing and implementing scalable and secure data processing pipelines using Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, and other Azure services.
  •     Managing and optimizing data storage using Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure SQL Data Warehouse.
  •     Developing data models and maintaining data architecture to support data analytics and business intelligence reporting.
  •     Ensuring data quality and consistency through data cleaning, transformation, and integration processes.
  •     Monitoring and troubleshooting data-related issues within the Azure environment to maintain high availability and performance.
  •     Collaborating with data scientists, business analysts, and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and implement appropriate data solutions.
  •     Implementing data security measures, including encryption, access controls, and auditing, to protect sensitive information.
  •     Automating data pipelines and workflows to streamline data ingestion, processing, and distribution tasks.
  •     Utilizing Azure's analytics services, such as Azure Synapse Analytics, to provide insights and support data-driven decision-making.
  •     Keeping abreast of the latest Azure features and technologies to enhance data engineering processes and capabilities.
  •     Documenting data procedures, systems, and architectures to maintain clarity and ensure compliance with regulatory standards.
  •     Providing guidance and support for data governance, including metadata management, data lineage, and data cataloging.

 

What’s in it for you?

Be an equal parent

Maternity support, including paid leave ahead of statutory guidelines, and flexible work options on return

Paternity support, including paid leave

New mothers can bring a caregiver and children under a year old, on work travel

Adoption support; gender neutral and based on the primary caregiver, with paid leave options

 

No place for discrimination at Godrej

Gender-neutral anti-harassment policy

Same sex partner benefits at par with married spouses

Gender transition support

We are selfish about your wellness

Comprehensive health insurance plans, as well as accident coverage for you and your family, with top-up options

Uncapped sick leave

Mental wellness and self-care programmes, resources and counselling

Celebrating wins, the Godrej Way 

Structured recognition platforms for individual, team and business-level achievements

Performance-based earning opportunities

https://www.godrejcareers.com/benefits/

 

An inclusive Godrej

 

Before you go, there is something important we want to highlight. There is no place for discrimination at Godrej. Diversity is the philosophy of who we are as a company. And has been for over a century. It’s not just in our DNA and nice to do. Being more diverse - especially having our team members reflect the diversity of our businesses and communities - helps us innovate better and grow faster. We hope this resonates with you.

 

We take pride in being an equal opportunities employer. We recognise merit and encourage diversity. We do not tolerate any form of discrimination on the basis of nationality, race, colour, religion, caste, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, age, or marital status and ensure equal opportunities for all our team members.


If this sounds like a role for you, apply now!

We look forward to meeting you.

description.7581:
*      ·         Ensure completion of quarterly audit calendar, as released by Regional / Group Head through proper planning, allocation and timely execution of audits,

·         Ensure the coverage of audits carried out by the team is as per the scope defined (in SAP),

·         Review of audit reports submitted by senior auditors to ensure quality of audits carried out by the team for release / further submission to the RH,

·         Identifying areas of concerns / concerning trends to the concerned business heads for audits carried out

·         Ensuring response to all audit reports are reviewed and audit file is closed within the prescribed TAT,

·         Release Medium risk audit reports.

·         Completion of UATs / system enhancement / process reviews, as assigned by the Regional Head,

·         Carrying out special reviews / investigations (if any) assigned by the Regional Head

·         Identification of areas, which are not being covered as a part of audit and putting in place a process to include the same as a part of audit calendar

·         Recommend for change in processes (as and when warranted and identified during his/her course of Audit review

·         Preparation of ACB / Board notes for the team and submission to HO.

Manage team, develop talent, build effective team and create bench strength.

description.8289:
Job Description

 

Job Title

Unit FG/ DG Stores Lead

Function

Manufacturing

Location

Large & Medium Units

Reporting Structure

Reports to

Unit Supply Chain Manager

Direct Reports

FG/ DG Store Executive(s)/ AM

 

 

OVERALL PURPOSE OF THE JOB

1As one of the largest FMCG, we rely on the efficiency and effectiveness of our material storage and handling at the manufacturing sites. An FG/ DG stores lead furthers the effectiveness of material management at the unit by providing his/ her expertise in warehouse management practices. This professional manages and oversees receiving, handling, storing, picking and packing activities within the warehouse/ store area ensuring safety and quality standards are always met.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

  •       Responsible for management of FG/ DG in the Storage area
  •       Enforce stock stocking and labelling (lot numbering) of DG as per SOP to ensure FIFO
  •       DG issue return
  •       Warehouse key management
  •       Compliance to audit points related to HA/SA
  •       Adherence to all pre-requisite requirements related to QA
  •       Safety requirements related to Permits/LOTO/Near miss
  •       Proper housekeeping
  •       5S implementation in DG area
  •       Safe and controlled loading arrangement
  •       Ensure sanitization of all the incoming vehicles
  •       Training to the team related to safe work practices and other trainings with social distancing or virtual trainings if possible
  •       XO implementation in Stores
  •       Proper upkeep of the area on ongoing basis
  •       To ensure all controls related to SOP’s in DG area and Scrap yard
  •       Verification of quantity of goods against specified norms/ standards
  •       Inventory management (Stock taking, documentation, issue/return, stock audits etc.)
  •       Monitor storage, handling, and production losses
  •       Scrap disposal – at optimum prices in a scheduled timeframe
  •       Ensure maintenance and documentation of all records related to Stores as per SOP
  •       To ensure legal compliance related to stores management
  •       Train and manage warehouse team to solve day-to-day operational issues and reach short- and long-term performance goals
  •       Review and prepare workflow, manning and space requirements, equipment layout, and action plans while ensuring productivity, quality and required service standards are met
  •       Conduct Cycle Count ( stock taking)as per SOP on the 1st of every month
  •       Maintain a safe and healthy work environment by establishing, following, and enforcing standards and procedures and complying with legal regulations
  •       Supervise daily activities of the stores/warehouse, including quality assurance, inventory control, space management, logistics, floor productivity, etc.
  •       Place vehicle indent with assigned Transporter basis inputs from Material Operations team.
  •       Share Monthly and Weekly lifting plan with transporters from respective suppliers to enable vehicle availability.
  •       Ensure timely unloading of trucks and tracking to avoid any detention
  •       Implementing and sustaining the requirements of all relevant standards and management systems (like FSMS, FSSAI Sch. 4, ISO 22K, FSSC 22K, ISO 9001, ISO 14001, ISO 45000/OHSAS 18000, GMP, etc.) in the work area
  •       Ensuring daily upkeep (Autonomous Maintenance activities) of Material Handling Equipment in the warehouse
  •       Conducting skill gap analysis for all workers in the work area, developing a need based training schedule, conducting trainings as per schedule and maintaining records of trainings
  •       Implementing and maintaining 5S & Good Warehouse Practices in Store(s)

 

KEY INTERFACE

 

INTERNAL

  1.       Material Manager
  2.       Material Operations
  3.       Unit Head
  4.       IT/ JDE Team
  5.       FG/DG Store Executives
  6.       Bottling Partner Team
  7.       Zonal SC Team

 

EXTERNAL

  1.       Vendors/ Suppliers
  2.       Scrap Dealers
  3.       Transporters/ Unions (in case as appl.)
  4.       Bonds (if outsourced)

 

 

JOB REQUIREMENTS

QUALIFICATIONS:

  •       Postgraduate in Operations Management/ SC Management/ Warehouse Management

 

EXPERIENCE:

  •       4+ years of relevant experience in a similar industry
  •       Well versed with Excel and Power Point
  •       Advanced knowledge of leading warehouse practices
  •       Familiarity with laws pertaining to excise is an added advantage
  •       Basic operational knowledge of ERP systems

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

PR India JD \ Unit DG/FG Stores Lead \ Jan 2022        Page 1 of 3
description.8296:
Key Deliverables:

•                    You will be expected to achieve the sales targets and qualitative & quantitative objectives set by the Regional Sales Manager

•                    You will drive business growth and manage distributors in the assigned territory

•                    You will be responsible to motivate, manage and develop customers (Salons) within a given geographic area for a specific brand portfolio

•                    You will have to identify opportunities and win new customers in accordance with the objectives set by the brand

•                    You need to ensure an effective educational partnership (recruit customers for training, attending events, etc.) in coordination with the Technical/Training team

•                    You will be responsible to ensure the range availability of the brand

•                    You will be accountable for the Social Commerce agenda of the region

•                    You will be expected to manage Distributor Sales Representatives (DSRs)

description.8357:
Ensures Accounts Payable were paid in an accurate and timely manner while adhering to departmental policies and procedure. 
	Processing & Registering the matching Media invoices utilizing the designated Finance accounting system. 
	Handle payment related queries from Vendors
	Identify, highlight and resolve issues related to process, statutory compliance etc.
	Timely payout to vendors as per defined SLA/TAT
	Follow-up on the SOA with vendor
	Able to handle GL queries
	Vendor reconciliation
	Generating and distributing monthly financial reports.
	Performing bank reconciliation for the Accounts payable account and updated the general ledger system as needed for outstanding checks. 
	Know how to handle and manage the conference calls with international stakeholders

description.9221:
Key responsibilities:

 

  • Monthly, Quarterly, Annual reporting
  • Support in preparation of segment cashflow
  • XBRL reporting and annual report verification
  • Consolidation of schedules, notes, workings for different subsidiaries.
  • Preparation of trend analysis on various items of Profit & Loss and Balance Sheet.
  • Creation of data dashboards for key governance items such as physical verification of inventories, customer confirmation etc.
  • Preparation of summary from the data dashboards.
  • Support to consolidation team on multiple files collation on various adhoc analysis. Collation of various MIS received from group subsidiaries.


Requirements:

  • CA Inter dropouts or Commerce Graduate with an experience of 2-3 years
  • Good to have experience – Financial Reporting, Balance Sheet, Accounts, MIS etc. Accounting experience works as well.
  • Contract Duration – 1 year (Can be extended basis performance)
